adjectives.description: allophone (comparative more allophone, superlative most allophone)

entries.meaning: (Canada) Of or relating to those whose mother tongue is neither English, French, nor (sometimes) an indigenous language of Canada.
That which is of a language other than that spoken by the majority.
(phonology) Any of two or more alternative pronunciations for a phoneme.
examples: [ʋ] is occasionally considered to be an allophone of /v/

entries.meaning: (Canada) A person whose mother tongue is neither English, French, nor (sometimes) an indigenous language of Canada.
A person whose mother tongue is one other than that spoken by the majority.
